tool.name: Max by lines
tool.description: Select maximum values in rows of a dataset

param.name: fichierTab
param.label: tabular file
param.help: Data table with header on the first row and a column with identifiers/informations. WARNING : This tabular file must contain only numeric values (exept header and first column)

param.name: nom1Colonne
param.label: Name of the first column of the table
param.help: Row field caracterising names of the lines where are maximum numeric values. WARNING : Dataset must contains no spaces.

param.name: nom2Colonne
param.label: Name of the second column of the table
param.help: Header field caracterising names of the column where are maximum numeric values. WARNING : Dataset must contains no spaces.

param.name: nom3Colonne
param.label: Nom de la troisiÃ¨me colonne du tableau
param.help: Header field caracterising names of the third column where are maximum numeric values. WARNING : Dataset must contains no spaces.

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**TIPS:** If your data are not tabular, use *File manipulation texte->Convert*
-----
**What it does**
It allows to generate dataset with: * line name * names of colmumns with maximum values * maximum values by line
**Example**
input dataset ::
Group.1 Barbar Eptser Inssp6 Leppun Minsch Myonat Noise dataset_538.dat 0.046 0.256 0.076 0.066 0.33 0.114 0.008 dataset_538.dat 0.098 0.18 0.234 0 0.08 0.114 0.004 dataset_539.dat 0.416 0.172 0.16 0.252 0.286 0.342 0.012 dataset_539.dat 0.378 0.138 0.094 0.002 0.196 0.456 0.07 dataset_539.dat 0.410 0.116 0.15 0.002 0.166 0.086 0.006 dataset_542.dat 0.074 0.15 0.02 0.002 0.026 0.348 0.192 dataset_542.dat 0.258 0.432 0.072 0.004 0.072 0.296 0.046 dataset_542.dat 0.252 0.382 0.086 0 0.03 0.046 0.004
Result ::
Nom_de_la_ligne Nom_de_colonne ValeurMax 1 dataset_538.dat Eptser 0.256 2 dataset_538.dat Inssp6 0.234 3 dataset_539.dat Barbar 0.416 4 dataset_539.dat Myonat 0.456 5 dataset_539.dat Barbar 0.410 6 dataset_542.dat Myonat 0.348 7 dataset_542.dat Eptser 0.432 8 dataset_542.dat Epster 0.382
